title: Rapid Acceleration

children.value:
A car of mass 
$\vari{m}$
 has an engine which can deliver power 
$\vari{P}$
.

What is the minimum time in which the car can be accelerated from rest to speed 
$\vari{v}$
?

answer.value:
The correct answer is (c). This can be seen since Energy Gained = Power 
$\times $
 Time, and the energy we want to gain is the kinetic energy at speed 
$\vari{v}$
, equal to 
$\vari{\frac{1}{2}mv^{2}}$
. This gives 
$\valuedef{Pt}{\frac{1}{2}mv^{2}}{}$
, which rearranges to the correct answer.
